Summary: LO for 2/4. Wet snow thawing and diminishing, generally good stability, surface instabilities possible in sun. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Wet snow throughout.  A clear sunny day.  Winds 20-30 mph.
Comment: Patchy cover remains, most snow is on North to East aspects above 1100 metres, very little elsewhere.
WeatherInfluences: A mild and sunny day with moderate South-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be above the summits.
SnowStability: The remaining snowpack will continue to thaw and diminish. Stability will be generally good although minor wet snow surface instabilities possible on steep slopes exposed to the sun. Any small sections of cornice that remain above North to East aspects above 1100 metres will be prone to collapse.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mild sunny day with fresh South-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was well above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The wet snowpack is slowly thawing, consolidating and diminishing. Snowpack stability is generally good. Some small sections of cornice remain above steep North to East aspects above 1100 metres, these are prone to collapse.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: CM for 2.4: Very patchy snow cover. A few small collapse prone cornices reamin over N to E aspects. Low Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground. Good visibility  Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts.
Comment: A fine weather day in prospect.
WeatherInfluences: Mild and dry throughout. Wednesday looking like another sunny day.
SnowStability: The very patchy snowpack will continue to thaw and remain well stabilised in all locations. Additional snow loss anticipated by the end of the day. Some potential for the collapse of residual minor cornices over selected steep North to East aspects.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Mild at all altitudes throughout the period and with sunshine during the day.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowpack is limited to receding small high altitude snow patches mainly on North to East aspects, a few as low as 800m. Good stability in all locations. Residual small collapse prone cornices remain over a few selected steep crags above 1000m.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: NC for 2.4: The patchy snowpack will thaw and be well bonded. Largest patches on N, E to SE aspects above 1000m. Low Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground. Good visibility, mainly sunny.   Winds approx 50 - 60 mph, at summit levels and on the plateau.
Comment: High pressure set to continue with mild temperatures.
WeatherInfluences: Dry conditions will continue, clear overnight and sunny during the day. Mild with freezing levels well above the highest summits.  Very strong Southerly winds will ease to fresh during the day.
SnowStability: The limited snowpack will continue to thaw and be well bonded and stable throughout. Patches will remain on corrie rims, steep corrie headwalls and high plateau areas, with deepest accumulations on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A sunny day with strong Southerly winds.  The freezing level was above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: Patches of snow remain on corrie rims, steep corrie backwalls and high plateau areas. The deepest and most widespread accumulations are on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters. The snowpack continues to diminish and is well bonded and stable throughout.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: GC 2/4. Patchy snow generally stable, isolated cornices fragile, wet snow instabilities may form in the sun. Low Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground. Good visibility.   Winds approx 10 to 20mph.
Comment: Similar conditions forecast for the week.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry and clear with plenty of sunshine through the day. Strong South-Easterly winds this evening will slowly ease. The freezing level will remain above the summits.
SnowStability: The remaining patchy snow, on mainly North to East aspects above 900 metres, will continue to thaw and diminish at all levels. Stability will be generally good. Some small surface instabilities may develop in steeper locations exposed to the sun. Any remaining isolated cornices on these aspects will be prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mild, dry and bright day, with plenty of sunshine. The freezing level was way above the summits, though it felt cool in the moderate to fresh South-Easterly winds. Warmer at lower elevations.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining patchy snow is thawing and diminishing at all levels. Stability is generally good. The greatest cover is mainly on North to East aspects above 900 metres, in gullies, on steep banks, and around coire rims and gully tops. A few drooping cornices were observed on higher summits on these aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: SC 2.4.25 Snow patches firm overnight, thawing during the day. Sun exposed slopes developing surface instabilities. Aval Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Good visibility.  Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts.
Comment: High pressure remains dominant bringing another sunny day. Snow patches will be firm and icy during the morning, softening during the daytime.
WeatherInfluences: Another sunny and dry day with no precipitation expected. Very strong South-Easterly winds overnight will ease by early morning to become fresh for the rest of the forecast period. The freezing level will remain above the summits.
SnowStability: Little change expected. The remaining snow patches will become firm overnight and continue to thaw and diminish in extent, during the day. Stability will be generally good, isolated wet snow surface instabilities will develop on steep sun exposed terrain above 950 metres, coire rims and gully tops most affected. The main snow deposits remain on the higher mountains along the Northern boundary of the forecast area. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry and sunny day with fresh Southerly winds. The freezing level was above the highest summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining snow patches continue to thaw and have good stability throughout. Steeper sun exposed slopes softened during the day. The greatest accumulations persist on North-West to North-East aspects in shady coires and gullies mostly on the higher mountains along the Northern boundary of the forecast area.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: TO for 2.4 Currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change.
SnowDistribution: Few snow patches remaining. Good visibility. Winds 10-20 mph.
Comment: Dry settled conditions are expected for next couple of days.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry and mild, with the freezing level well above all summits. Winds will be generally Southerly, strong overnight easing through the day.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a bright dry day, with the freezing level well above all summits. Winds were moderate to strong South-South-Easterly.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
